ADAM17 is also involved in resistance to PRRSV entry. cleavage produces soluble CD163 (sCD163) (16–18) cleavage is species-specific because the CD163 juxtamembrane region in certain nonprimates lacks the substrate motif (1044Arg-Ser-Ser-Arg) this suggests that the cleavage of porcine CD163 by ADAM17 might be caused by viral infection. nontarget cells (BHK-21, PK-15, and CHO-K1) expressing CD163 are infected by VR2332, the North American type of PRRSV (52) this study showed that ADAM17 suppresses PRRSV entry by downregulation of membrane CD163 expression level. this results indicate that ADAM17 is further activated by viral infection and that ADAM17 downregulates CD163. AM17 and sCD163 may be useful in enhancing porcine anti-PRRSV response.
